channel.title: Posts on Denis' Digital Garden
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Denis' Digital Garden

item.title: Go has new generic slices and map packages
item.description:
More Generics in the Standard Library

Since the introduction of generics in Go 1.18, there have been discussions about adding new helper functions to the standard library to cover most frequent operations. After more than a year, two new libraries with generics will be added12 into the Go standard library starting from Go 1.21.

item.title: Kubectl cheatsheet
item.description: Throughout the years of using kubernetes as a developer I’ve collected a bunch of useful commands that helped me to debug issues and have better understanding of what is happening in the cluster.

item.title: Safe git force push
item.description: You’ve likely been in this situation before. You make some minor code fixes, do git commit --ammend to add them to the current commit, and do git push --force. Then, you happily open pull request and see that you’ve deleted you’re colleagues commit.ðŸ˜©

item.title: Introduction to Gonkey -- Testing automation tool
item.description: Gonkey is a testing automation tool that can test your service API without a single line of code.

item.title: Fundamentals of software architecture book overview. Part 1. Who is an Architect?
item.description: Fundamentals of software architecture is a book by Mark Richards and Neal Ford â€” hands-on practitioners who have taught software architecture classes professionally for yearsâ€”focus on architecture principles that apply across all technology stacks. This book left me with good basis of what role software architect plays in a company and extended my knowledge of different architecture patterns. In the following series of articles I’ll write about topics from this book that I liked most.
